intro: Commelina thomasii, commonly known as Thomas's spiderwort, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many species with striking floral structures. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces small, white or pale blue flowers with three petals and three sepals. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Commelina thomasii is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors and wetlands.
